newsitem.title: BELGIUM: TENNIS-MIXED FORTUNES FOR CZECHS IN EC TOURNAMENT.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-MIXED FORTUNES FOR CZECHS IN EC TOURNAMENT.

text.p: Czech players had contrasting fortunes in the quarter-finals of the European Community tournament on Friday with Petr Korda winning easily but Martin Damm retiring after only four games.
Korda trounced Belgian qualifier Dick Norman, the tallest player on the ATP tour at 2.03 metres, 6-3 6-4.
Damm, who had sprained his ankle in the last set of his second round match against Chilean Marcelo Rios on Thursday, was trailing German Marc Goellner 3-1 in the first set when he pulled out.
"I did not expect him to give up," said Goellner. "I saw him in the locker room before and he did about 10, 15 kangeroo jumps and I thought 'okay, he's top fit'," he said.
But he soon noted that Damm, who had also played a doubles match after hurting his ankle, appeared slower and his service weaker than usual.
Norman said he felt somewhat tired mentally and physically after his late night shock win over fifth seed Felix Mantilla of Spain on Thursday.
"I just was unable to attack on Korda's service," he said.
Korda, who will meet either Belgian lucky loser Filip Dewulf or Swiss Marc Rosset in the semifinals, said he was not feeling 100 percent but was determined to fight for victory.
He said he had had flu before a Davis Cup encounter with India two weeks ago.
